Title: JSON Operators
Description: The SQLite -> and ->> operators, introduced in version 3.38.0, facilitate the extraction of subcomponents from JSON data. Compatible with both MySQL and PostgreSQL, these operators take a JSON string or JSONB blob on the left and a PATH expression or object field label/array index on the right. The -> operator yields a text JSON representation of the subcomponent or NULL; the ->> operator returns an SQL type corresponding to the subcomponent's value. The key difference between the two is the format of the returned value: -> provides a JSON representation, while ->> delivers an SQL representation. Unlike json_extract() with two arguments, these operators always return the subcomponent in the expected format. Additionally, the right-hand operand can be a JSON path expression, a text label, or an integer, which is interpreted as a JSON path accordingly.
